ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:0.4_0: The first training rule on acknowledgment
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:0.5_0: Venerables, these four rules on acknowledgment come up for recitation.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.2_0: a certain nun was returning from almsround in Sāvatthī. She saw a monk and said to him,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.5_0: But because the time for eating was coming to an end, she was not able to go for alms, and she missed her meal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.7_0: and the following day the same thing happened again.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.10_0: But because the time for eating was coming to an end, she was not able to go for alms, and she missed her meal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.12_0: as the merchant asked her why.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.14_0: As she stepped aside, she collapsed right there.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.15_0: And the merchant asked her for forgiveness:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.16_0: “Forgive me, Venerable, since you fell because of me.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.20_0: The nun told him what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.21_0: After making that merchant householder’s house, he complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.22_0: “How can the venerables receive food directly from a nun?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.23_0: It’s difficult for women to get material support.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.24_0: The monks heard the complaints of that merchant,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.25_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.26_0: “How can a monk receive food directly from a nun?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.27_0: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.31_0: “Foolish man, a man and a woman who are unrelated don’t know what’s appropriate and what’s inappropriate in dealing with each other, what’s right and what’s wrong.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.32_0: “... Foolish man, how can you receive food from an unrelated nun?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.33_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.34_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.35.1_0: ‘If a monk receives staple or non-staple food directly from an unrelated nun who has entered an inhabited area, and then eats it, he must acknowledge it:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.36_0: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.6_0: anyone who is not a descendant of one’s male ancestors going back seven generations, either on the mother’s side or on the father’s side.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.8_0: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.10_0: a street, a cul-de-sac, an intersection, a house.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.12_0: apart from the five staple foods, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics—the rest is called “non-staple food”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.14_0: there are five kinds of staple food: cooked grain, porridge, flour, fish, and meat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.15_0: If he receives staple or non-staple food with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.16_0: For every mouthful, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.1_0: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he receives staple or non-staple food directly from her when she has entered an inhabited area, and then eats it, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.2_0: If she is unrelated, but he is unsure of it, and he receives staple or non-staple food directly from her when she has entered an inhabited area, and then eats it, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.3_0: If she is unrelated, but he perceives her as related, and he receives staple or non-staple food directly from her when she has entered an inhabited area, and then eats it, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.4_0: If he receives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.5_0: For every mouthful, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.6_0: One who is fully ordained only on one side—aple food or staple—
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.7_0: If he receives staple or non-staple food with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.8_0: For every mouthful, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.9_0: If she is related, but he perceives her as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.10_0: If she is related, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.11_0: If she is related, and he perceives her as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.3_0: if she has someone else give it and does not give herself;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.4_0: if she gives by placing it near the person;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.5_0: between the monastery and the Buddha,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.6_0: if it is at the dwelling place of nuns;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.7_0: if it is at the dwelling place of the ascetics of another religion;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.8_0: if it is on returning to the monastery;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.9_0: if she gives it away after getting them to a village;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.10_0: if she gives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics, saying, “When there’s a reason, make use of these;”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.11_0: if it is a trainee nun;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.12_0: if it is to a novice nun;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.14_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.15_0: The first training rule on acknowledgment is finished.
